recipe_name: Chinese beef with cashews and soy chilli dressing
author: Paul Rankin
method: Rub the olive oil into the steak and season with the freshly ground black pepper.  Heat a frying pan over a high heat. Add the steak and fry for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until cooked to your liking. Remove and set aside in a warm place to rest. Add the soy sauce, honey, chilli and lime to the pan the steak was cooked in and mix thoroughly. Cook over a medium heat for 2-3 minutes until the sauce has reduced to a sticky glaze.  To serve, cut the steak in half. Place the cooked rice noodles onto a serving plate, arrange the slices of steak on top, and pour the juices from the pan all over.
ingredients: 1 tbsp olive oil,  100g/3½oz sirloin steak,  freshly ground black pepper,  1 tbsp soy sauce,  1 tbsp honey,  1 red chilli, finely sliced,  ½ lime, juice only,  100g/3½oz rice noodles, cooked according to packet instructions
